enb_long_title: UNFCCC WORKSHOPS ON CONVENTION ARTICLE 4.8 AND 4.9 (ADVERSE EFFECTS)
section_title: Impact of response measures on the coal industry:
sentences: Ron Knapp, Chief Executive of the World Coal Institute, outlined key aspects of the international coal market, noting the rise in consumption in developing countries.
He emphasized that both coal producer and consumer countries will be adversely affected by response measures, but that effects will be unevenly distributed.

He said the objective of the Kyoto Protocol is to reduce GHGs, not carbon intensity, and called for: effective market solutions, including the use of voluntary measures and the Kyoto mechanisms; technological development in response to market circumstances; and the promotion of clean coal technology.
